intro: Methonica abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian methonica, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a slightly hairy surface. Methonica abyssinica is often found growing in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
